awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigators Award: Uptake and Release  Mechanisms for Organic Contaminants in Soils and Aqueous    Systems
awd_abstract_narration: This is an award to support research by this Presidential                       Young Investigator (PYI) on physical and chemical                               mechanisms that affect migration of synthetic organic                           chemicals in groundwater and the fate of these                                  contaminants when the water is extracted from subsurface                        aquifers and subjected to water treatment processes.  This                      project involves investigation of the extent and rate of                        organic contaminant uptake by natural solids found in                           soils and determination of the controlling mechanisms.                                                                                                          This is the initial, base-level award for this PYI.                             Results of this research are likely to be applied in                            engineering design of processes and systems for                                 decontamination of soil contaminated by organic chemicals                       from accidental spills or by substances leaching from                           disposal sites for hazardous wastes.  The results may also                      be applied in engineering design of treatment processes                         for removal of organic contaminants from water.
org_div_long_name: Division of Chemical, Bioengineering, Environmental, and Transport Systems
